name: AIDS Action Committee
descr: Since 1993, Check-In volunteers have provided information and referrals, along with ,a sensitive and caring ear, to AIDS Action Committeeâ€™s clients, helping to maintain a strong connection between clients and staff members. Volunteers complement our services by helping clients work through problems and encouraging successes over the phone.
dates: Tuesday and Wednesday nights 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm

name: All Hands and Hearts
descr: We are currently working around the world to help communities affected by natural disasters. As a volunteer, you'd be a critical part of rebuilding homes and schools for community members post-disaster.
dates: We accept volunteers on a rolling basis for however long you're available. We've had volunteers join us for a day, a week, or even months on end!
location: Our programs are in Texas, Puerto Rico, the US Virgin Islands, the British Virgin Islands, Mexico and Dominica. Once you apply and are confirmed, you will receive the exact address and directions to the base.

name: Art Resource Collaborative for Kids (ARCK)
descr: Miles of Murals is a free community wide festival along David Ortiz Dr. across from Fenway Park. There will be an area for vendors, activities, food, and dancing.  There will also be live chalk artists along David Ortiz Dr. that will lead to the unveiling of our mural project Miles of Murals: Walls that Speak.  After the unveiling, there will be a ticketed gallery reception and silent auction featuring art from our students and local artists.
dates: May 4 2019. 11-9pm; various time slots within we will work with you

name: Artists for Humanity
descr: The best way to volunteer with Artists For Humanity is to come visit our studios, meet our young people, and talk with us about how you can become involved. Volunteers spread the word about what our teens can do, promote our art work, refer young people who could benefit from working with us, work on special projects and/or provide 1:1 tutoring to teens. Tutoring is one of the key ways to get involved. As an after-work supplemental program, tutoring provides critical support to AFH teen artists to ensure a stronger pathway toward academic success.
dates: Our program runs on Mondays and Fridays from 3pm-6pm and on Tuesdays Wednesdays and Thursdays from 6pm-8pm. In general we ask that volunteers commit to one day a week for at least one semester.

name: Bilingual Education for Central America
descr: BECA aims to provide its volunteers with a challenging, transformative experience that gives an in-depth understanding of grassroots international development, underserved Central American communities, bilingual teaching strategies, and community capacity building techniques. As a result, BECA teachers develop the skills and responsibilities to be effective teachers, communicators, and leaders.
dates: July 8 2019 to June 2020 for full-year volunteers who commit to one academic school year. January 2020 to June 2020 for half-year volunteers.
location: Cofradia and Vida Nueva Cortes; Macuelizo, Santa Barabara, Honduras

name: Boston Center for Refugee Health and Human Rights
descr: BCRHHR is looking for highly motivated people with excellent interpersonal and communication skills to support our mission.  Volunteer opportunities involving direct client contact are determined on a case by case basis.  Many opportunities are administrative or research oriented.
dates: Monday-Friday 9am-5pm
location: Boston Medical Center - Dowling 7 840 Harrison Ave

name: Boston Landmarks Orchestra
descr: Boston Landmarks Orchestra hosts summer orchestral concert series at the Hatch Shell. Volunteers should arrive by 5:30 PM and will finish close to 9:30 pm. The concert will be held in the Hatch Memorial Shell on the Esplanade, located at 47 David G Mugar Way, Boston, MA 02108. The nearest MBTA stations are the Charles/MGH stop on the Red Line and the Arlington stop on the Green Line. Volunteers will be passing out programs, intercepting surveys, providing customer service at information tent, helping with chair rentals, and floating to perform other duties as needed. All volunteers receive a free t-shirt, snacks, and get to enjoy great music!
dates: Every Wednesday beginning 7/11/18 to 8/29/18 from 5:30-9:30pm. Doesn't have to be every Wednesday

name: Boston Partners in Education
descr: Boston Partners places volunteer academic mentors into BPS classrooms to give students more individualized attention during the school day.  Volunteers are matched according to their preferences and availability to supports students in their academic and social-emotional learning for one hour each week of the school year.  We welcome volunteers of all backgrounds, but are an especially great fit for anyone interested in pursuing education or social work as a career path.
dates: Applications accepted on a rolling basis from July-January

name: Boston's Forgotten Felines
descr: We want to help end the overpopulation of feral and homeless cats on the streets of Boston.  To this end we trap, neuter (or spay) feral and homeless cats.  We coordinate other veterinary care for these cats when necessary.  We release fixed feral cats and ensure their survival by providing daily care for them in their street homes (known as colonies), including monitoring for health, safety and new arrivals, feeding, providing shelter and other protection from the elements.  We evaluate homeless cats for adoptability and turn these cats over to local, no-kill animal shelters or foster homes.  We provide support to these shelters and foster homes upon request.  And, although we believe that a program of TNR (Trap, Neuter, Release) is a vital part of ending overpopulation, we know that it is not the only part.  Education is a very important part of the solution. We provide education to the public about the importance of spay and neuter programs and the about problems faced by homeless cats.  We will train volunteers to help us with any or all of these activities.
dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

name: Cambridge Community Television
descr: CCTV relies on volunteers to keep our organization running smoothly. Interns provide CCTV with valuable work hours every week in many difference capacities, and in exchange our interns get experience and training in everything that makes a television station tick. Possible unpaid intern positions include live cablecasting, media production, computer lab supervision, training and education, and many administrative responsibilities. All interns work 2-10 hours per week and receive an Access Membership, regardless of residency. There are many departments to intern in. CCTV relies on volunteers who agree to provide regular assistance to staff in some area of operations. Anyone, regardless of their age or place of residence, may apply to become a CCTV intern. Please note, not all kinds of internships are available at all times, as openings depend on CCTV's needs at the moment. However, even if the kind of internship you are interested in is not immediately available, we will keep your application on file should there be an opening.
dates: Varied
location: Cambridge Community Television 438 Massachusetts Avenue Cambridge MA 02139

name: Chelsea Collaborative
descr: The Collaborative runs an after school program for our middle and high school youth. The middle school program focuses on art as a form of therapeutic expression and literacy, while the high school program focuses on homework/academic support. We are seeking volunteers to work in either program.
dates: Monday-Thursday, weekly, 4-7pm (Ideally volunteers would commit to coming in on the same days each week)

name: Cradles to Crayons
descr: The Champion Program is for students who would like to volunteer on a weekly or bi-weekly basis during one of our designated two and a half hour shifts . As a Champion, volunteers will be trained in at least one of our donation processing stations. Once a Champion is trained, they are responsible for leading the station with anywhere from 10-25 volunteers. For example, an Outfit Station Champion orients and oversees a group of volunteers as they put together outfit packs that contain about a week's worth of clothing.
dates: We are looking for reliable students to commit to a regular weekly or bi-weekly schedule. We are looking for a commitment for an entire semester at a time. Our shifts are as follows: Wednesday through Saturday Morning Shift: 9:45 am-12:15 pm Afternoon Shift: 1:15 pm-3:45 pm.

name: Daily Table
descr: Volunteers are an integral part of the Daily Table family. As we continue to receive more produce from our agricultural and retail partners, the need for volunteers grows. Volunteers can expect to: sort and prepare produce in our receiving area for sale or for kitchen use, label and package prepared foods alongside our kitchen staff, help cooks in the kitchen, stock retail shelves, stock/reorganize cooler and freezer units,interact with customers in our food sampling/engagement area
dates: Monday-Saturday: 9am-8pm; Sunday: 11am-6pm. Require minimum of 3 hours for kitchen volunteers. 10 volunteers allowed per each hour slot

name: Day or Night Care
descr: At home care services for underserved elderly population. Tasks can include light cooking, cleaning, shopping, etc. as well as basic companionship.
dates: Year round - 24/7

name: Department of Children and Families
descr: For a few hours of your time each month, you can participate on a panel that helps plan a brighter future for each child in care. DCF is required by law to review each foster child's case every six months. The review is conducted by a three member panel, with one member being from the local community. A volunteer reviewer can make a difference for child. For more information http://www.mass.gov/eohhs/gov/departments/dcf/giving/volunteer-case-review/  Or contact us at 1-800-286-0323
dates: The schedules are flexible and happen Monday-Friday during business hours.

name: Discovering Justice
descr: Children Discovering Justice (CDJ) is a literacy-based social studies curriculum for elementary and middle school, that provides students with the tools to understand sophisticated ideas such as democracy, tolerance, rights, responsibilities, and the connection between rules and law. CDJ includes interactive mock trials that further empower children to stand up for their beliefs, engage in respectful discourse, and resolve differences in constructive ways. Volunteers are needed to support students during these Mock Trial Field Trips.
dates: Throughout the School Year between 10:00AM and 12:00PM

name: El Centro Del Cardenal Language School- Catholic Charities
descr: This school is a free, intensive, community-based ESL(English as a second language) school. We are looking for volunteers to come to our classes once a week and engage with our students. Most of our students are immigrants learning English, improving their academic skills, and trying to assimilate into American society. Our students do not get much access to native speakers besides the time they spend with their teachers. I would like to invite anyone who is interested in helping our students to come to our school.
dates: Monday-Thursday anytime between 9am-1pm
location: 19 St Joseph St Jamaica Plain MA 02130

name: Family Gym
descr: Family Gym provides an open environment that encourages families to be active together through non-fee based recreational use of Bostonâ€™s community centers (BCYF). Each week volunteers assist the supervisor in leading activity stations such as jump rope, toddler slide, or soccer with participants. Family Gym holds 8 to 10 sessions on Saturday mornings from 10:00 m to 11:30am for families each semester in several Boston communities to promote healthy eating habits and increased physical activity through play. Volunteers are allowed 2 absences per semester. Our programming consists of unstructured free play, a health theme, structured group games, and a cool down activity (animal stretches).
dates: Saturdays from 9:00AM to 12:00 PM / October to December (Fall Semester) or February to April (Spring Semester)

name: Fighting Against Multiple Sclerosis (FAMS)
descr: The MS Ambassador program is run by FAMS with the collaboration of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, The Greater New England Chapter. MS Ambassadors are individuals who are passionate about the cause, and they attend volunteer fairs, representing FAMS and the National MS Society, attend fundraiser and awareness events, and advocate for change.
dates: Multiple opportunities during the calendar year (reach out to them for more information)

name: Fresh Truck
descr: Fresh Truck is a nonprofit mobile food market working to radically impact community health by getting food to people that need it the most. Fresh Truck volunteers work on the bus at markets to engage with customers, bag and restock items on the bus, as well as assist in clean up at the end. And if volunteers help us out, we'll send them home with a free bag of groceries!
dates: Opportunities Sunday-Friday every week

name: Gift of Life
descr: To enter the bone registry, all a person needs to do is swab the inside of their cheek! Then they'll be entered into the registry and has the opportunity to potentially match with someone who is battling blood cancer, essentially saving their life
dates: ongoing (reach out to them for more information)

name: Girl's LIFE
descr: We are looking for volunteers to serve as mentors for our teen girls! We partner workshops with one-to-one mentoring, so you can have an impact on an individual's life. For 10 program days, you meet with our group and help provide support for your mentee. No financial background necessary! We will orient/ train all volunteers prior to start. This date and time is TBD based off of volunteers' availability.
dates: March 6-May 8 Wednesdays 5:30-7:30pm

name: Haitian-American Public Health Initiatives
descr: HAPHI is interested in serving as a site for student volunteers to assist with teaching adult ESOL classes
dates: Monday and Friday ESOL classes from 10:00 AM- 12:00 PM

name: Haley House
descr: Haley House, a 50-year-old nonprofit in Boston, operates a soup kitchen, food pantry, urban farm, and housing program in the South End, and a Bakery CafÃ© and pizza restaurant in Dudley Square. Haley House is seeking 3â€“5 interns and summer residents for its summer internship and residency program this year. Interns and residents are unpaid, though room and board are provided. Interns and residents will be integrated into life in the Live-In Community, a group of residential volunteers who co-manage Haley Houseâ€™s direct services and commit to life together as a community, building deep connections with each other and our guests.
dates: varies (reach out to them for more information)

name: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter
descr: The Harvard Square Homeless Shelter (HSHS) and Y2Y Harvard Square need volunteers to help provide shelter at a critical time of the year for individuals experiencing homelessness in the local community. Volunteers are needed for breakfast, dinner, evening, and overnight shifts. Our shelters offer opportunities for students to develop understanding of the greater issues surrounding homelessness and gain leadership experience! Start your volunteer journey by applying for a regular weekly shift, a break shift, or one time substitute shifts; both individuals and groups are welcome. Contact hshs.engagement@gmail.com or volunteer.y2y@gmail.com to learn more!
dates: November 1 - April 15
location: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter 66 Winthrop Street Cambridge MA 02138

name: Have a Hart Day Boston
descr: We will be sorting food in a warehouse. This will involve being on your feet, possibly lifting 30 lb. boxes, and possibly interacting with packaged frozen meat/pork products.

name: HernÃ¡ndez After School Program
descr: We are looking for volunteers to serve as tutors, club leaders, and extra support during our after school program. This position would be best suited for volunteers who love working with youth, are interested in education, tutoring, and mentoring, and who are comfortable in a multi-lingual and multi-cultural environment. Scheduling is flexible, as the program runs Monday-Friday from 3:15pm-6:15pm. We ask that our volunteers serve at least one hour a week during the program for at least one semester. Bilingual English/Spanish volunteers or those interested in learning Spanish are preferred.
dates: Monday-Friday 3:15pm-6:15pm
location: Rafael HernÃ¡ndez School 61 School St. Roxbury MA 02119

name: Horizons for Homeless Children
descr: BECOME A SUPERHERO TO HOMELESS CHILDREN!Horizons needs volunteers throughout the Boston Metro area to make a difference in the lives of children living in family homeless shelters. By volunteering each week to play children who otherwise wouldnâ€™t have this opportunity, youâ€™ll become their superhero.Volunteer with homeless children at a Horizons Playspace installed in one of more than 90 family shelters state-wide including in Dorchester, Roxbury, Mattapan, Jamaica Plain, Newton, Brighton, Charlestown, East Boston, Fenway, Somerville, and Cambridge. An initial training and a commitment of two hours a week for six months are required. Horizons for Homeless Children is a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of homeless children by providing opportunities for quality play and early education. To find out more, view other training dates, or to apply, call 617.553.5488 or visit horizonschildren.org/playspace.
dates: Weekly 2 hour commitment for at least 6 months. Same day and time. Shift options Monday-Thursday 6-8pm
location: Boston Area SheltersTraining is at 1705 Columbus Ave Roxbury. Volunteering takes place at 27 sites all over Boston area

name: Housing Families Inc.
descr: Work with kids who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in a variety of ways. Housing Families offer kids (from pre-k-12th grade) access to tutoring, childcare, enrichment groups, therapeutic groups and counseling. Volunteer hours are from 3-6 Monday-Friday (Wednesday 3-7) for tutoring, and 6-730 pm Monday-Thursday for childcare. Volunteers are only required to commit to one hour/week. Interns can help with tutoring, childcare, and enrichment groups during those same time blocks. Interns are also welcome to come in earlier in the day to help with other projects around our program including, helping with folders for tutoring, organizing program, sorting and organizing books, preparing enrichment group activities, and other assorted jobs around the office.
dates: Monday-Friday 3-6 (Wednesday 3-7) -- weekly

name: Immigrant Learning Center
descr: In the classroom, you can help new Americans achieve their personal and professional goals through learning English and gaining an understanding of American culture.
dates: Classes are Monday through Friday 9:00 am- 11:30 am and Monday through Thursday 12:00-3:00. The ILC asks that volunteers commit to at least one class per week.
